Hasun Kang is investigating both painting and drawing to offer an aesthetic experience that draws on societal approaches to abstraction. She is keen on interdisciplinary collaboration with fields like psychology and sociology, with a view to creating works that serve marginalized communities. Additionally, she is fascinated by how abstraction has evolved in contemporary art movements. Hasun received her BFA in Woodworking Furniture and Visual Communication from Hongik University in Seoul. Before embarking on an art career, she worked as a product designer at NAVER corporation in South Korea.
